environments.title: Lightly obscured
environments.subtitle: Disadvantage on Perception
environments.description: Dim light, patchy fog, moderate foliage
bullets: Creatures have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

environments.title: Heavily obscured
environments.subtitle: Effectively blind
bullets: A creature in a heavily obscured area effectively suffers from the blinded condition.

environments_light.title: Bright light
environments_light.subtitle: Normal vision
environments_light.description: Bright light lets most creatures see normally
bullets: Gloomy days still provide bright light, as do torches, lanterns, fires, and other sources of illumination within a specific radius.

environments_light.title: Dim light
environments_light.subtitle: Lightly obscured
bullets: Creates a lightly obscured area.
An area of dim light is usually a boundary between a source of bright light, such as a torch, and surrounding darkness.
The soft light of twilight and dawn also counts as dim light. A particularly brilliant full moon might bathe the land in dim light.

environments_light.title: Darkness
environments_light.subtitle: Heavily obscured
environments_light.description: Darkness creates a heavily obscured area
bullets: Creates a heavily obscured area.
Characters face darkness outdoors at night (even most moonlit nights), within the confines of an unlit dungeon or a subterranean vault, or in an area of magical darkness.

environments_vision.title: Blindsight
environments_vision.subtitle: Perceive without sight
environments_vision.description: Perceive your surroundings without relying on sight, within a certain radius
bullets: Creatures without eyes, such as oozes, and creatures with echolocation or heightened senses, such as bats and true dragons, have this sense.

environments_vision.title: Darkvision
environments_vision.subtitle: Limited vision in darkness
environments_vision.description: A creature with Darkvision can see better in the dark or low light conditions, within a certain radius
bullets: Within a specified range, a creature with darkvision can see in darkness as if the darkness were dim light, so areas of darkness are only lightly obscured as far as that creature is concerned.
However, the creature can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Many creatures in the worlds of D&D, especially those that dwell underground, have darkvision.

environments_vision.title: Truesight
environments_vision.subtitle: See in darkness
environments_vision.description: A creature with truesight can see everything in its true form, independent of the environment
bullets: A creature with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceives the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic.
Furthermore, the creature can see into the Ethereal Plane.

environments_cover.title: Half cover
environments_cover.subtitle: Low wall, furniture, creatures
environments_cover.description: A target has half cover if an obstacle blocks at least half of its body
bullets: The obstacle might be a low wall, a large piece of furniture, a narrow tree trunk, or a creature, whether that creature is an enemy or a friend.
A target with half cover has a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies

environments_cover.title: Three-quarters cover
environments_cover.subtitle: Portcullis, arrow slit
environments_cover.description: A target has three-quarters cover if about three-quarters of it is covered by an obstacle
bullets: The obstacle might be a portcullis, an arrow slit, or a thick tree trunk.
A target with three-quarters cover has a +5 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies

environments_cover.title: Full cover
environments_cover.subtitle: Completely concealed
environments_cover.description: A target has total cover if it is completely concealed by an obstacle
bullets: A target with total cover can’t be targeted directly by an attack or a spell, although some spells can reach such a target by including it in an area of effect.
If a target is behind multiple sources of cover, only the most protective degree of cover applies
